name: St Davids Head Circular
description: Stunning headland walk from Whitesands Bay. Ancient Neolithic enclosure and dramatic views to Ramsey Island.

name: Dinas Head
description: Not actually an island but a peninsula separated by a low valley. A classic short circular with a pub at the start/finish.

name: Stackpole & Barafundle
description: Includes the famous Barafundle Bay and Bosherston Lily Ponds. One of the most varied and beautiful coastal walks in Wales.

name: Marloes Peninsula
description: Wild and dramatic peninsula with views to Skomer Island. Great for seal spotting in autumn.

name: Porthdinllaen & Morfa Nefyn
description: Visit the famous Ty Coch Inn on the beach. A lovely short walk on the headland with lifeboat station and stunning bay views.

name: Aberdaron & Mynydd Mawr
description: The Land's End of Wales. Walk to the tip of the peninsula overlooking Bardsey Island (Ynys Enlli).

name: Porth Oer (Whistling Sands)
description: Famous for its singing sands. A rugged section of coast with jagged cliffs and hidden coves.

name: Yr Eifl (The Rivals)
description: Dominating peaks of the peninsula. Includes Tre'r Ceiri, one of the best preserved Iron Age hillforts in Europe.

name: Newborough & Llanddwyn Island
description: Magical tidal island dedicated to St Dwynwen, patron saint of lovers. Stunning views to Snowdonia across the water.

name: Holyhead Mountain
description: The highest point on Anglesey. Combines dramatic sea cliffs near South Stack with ancient hut circles and sweeping views.

name: Porth Cwyfan (Church in the Sea)
description: Visit St Cwyfan's Church, accessible only at low tide. A peaceful stretch of coast away from the main tourist spots.

name: Moelfre to Lligwy
description: Historic stretch of coast, site of the Royal Charter shipwreck. Passes the lifeboat station and sandy Lligwy beach.

name: Three Cliffs Bay
description: One of the most photographed spots in Wales. A loop from Parkmill taking in the castle ruins and the iconic three cliffs.

name: Oxwich Point
description: A varied walk through ancient woodland and along the limestone headland. Starts and ends at the beautiful Oxwich Bay.

name: Whiteford Point & Lighthouse
description: Walk to the only wave-swept cast-iron lighthouse in Britain. Remote, quiet, and great for birdwatching.

name: Mwnt & Foel y Mwnt
description: Short but sweet climb up the conical hill of Foel y Mwnt. Famous for dolphin spotting and the whitewashed Holy Cross Church.

name: Llangrannog & Ynys Lochtyn
description: Stunning section of the Ceredigion Coast Path. The view of the seal-frequented peninsula of Ynys Lochtyn is a classic.

name: New Quay to Cwmtydu
description: A tougher walk with plenty of ups and downs. Cwmtydu was once a smugglers' cove. Look out for bottlenose dolphins.

name: Aberystwyth to Borth
description: Classic linear walk over Constitution Hill and along high cliffs. Return by train for a perfect day out.
